transcripts.text: Over the weekend, Donald Trump accrued a new nickname, Bunker Boy, sometimes Bunker Baby.  And it's because when protesters were outside of the White House, he fled as far underground as possible to the bunker.  Or did he?  Because he wants you to now believe that that's not actually what happened.  It was all just a coincidence that he was in the bunker.  What could you tell me Sunday night was like for you and your family?

Well, it was a false report.  I wasn't down.  I went down during the day and I was there for a tiny little short period of time.  It was much more for an inspection.  There was no problem during the day.  The problem I saw Leland got.  Whacked pretty good, but that was during the night.  And this problem, these problems are during the night, not during the day.  And I go down, I've gone down two or three times, all for inspection.  And you go there, someday you may need it, but you go there and I went down... I looked at it.  It was during the day.  It was not a problem.  And I read about it like a big thing.  There was never a problem.  We never had a problem.  Nobody ever came close to giving us a problem.
So what I thought of it was that it was during the day.

Yeah.  He thinks, wait, if I say winter than day, then it wouldn't make sense that it was based on fear.  I got him.  Okay, and also, hey, hey, I wasn't scared.  It was just a coincidence.  I needed to inspect the bunker.  After all, I've done it.  He goes on to say, I've inspected the bunker two and a half times as president.  Okay, you've been president for three and a half years.  So on average, you do it not even once a year.  You just happened to inspect it on the day of the protest.  That is a mighty fine coincidence for you, bunker boy.

Yeah, I checked it out.  You mentioned the two and a half times, right?  Did you mention the two and a half times?  So two and a half times.  So how is it?  you inspect a bunker a half a time?  And also those other two times that you went were for a very tiny, short period of time.  So for the half a time you went, how short was it?  the time, so a half of a tiny amount of time to inspect.  What did you inspect?  What did you check out to make sure that the Berber carpet was clean?  What are you inspecting about this bunker?

Why would he be inspecting it in the first place?  If a nuke is on its way to DC, they hustle him down and drag him into the bunker.  It's not like he goes in if he likes the decor.  He's not going to, it's not gold.  He has to go in there if it's an actual threat.  It's just, it's such BS.  And look, I understand, does this matter?  No, the nicknames don't matter.  None of it matters.  Substantively, the issue is that he has no interest in bringing people together and he has no interest in any sort of reform because he is an authoritarian.  and authoritarians don't constrain the power of the police state, obviously, that's the thing.  But if this can get through to one red hat wearer that thinks this guy is some sort of alpha or tough guy, he ran to the bunker when there was no threat to him whatsoever.  The same guy who had bone spurs during Vietnam, who told you that if he was outside of Marjory Stoneman Douglas, he would have run in even without a gun.  He would have run in to take down the shooter.  He doesn't walk over to protesters with guitars because of how scared he is.  He flees the bunker even for that.  And so substantively, does this matter?  Perhaps not.  But if you still follow this guy, and if you follow him out of some belief that he's tough or strong or what this country needs, this is who he is.  He's good and soft.

So as he's talking about how he just went for inspection, let's not forget Caitlin Collins of CNN reported yesterday.  that she has sources, you know how that works. That was part of his motivation.  He's like, I got to show them I'm a tough guy.  That was it.  He didn't like the negative coverage of what had happened.  So now he's still stuck on it. Secret Service can suggest what they want, but that wasn't what happened.  I didn't listen to them.  So next time you tell me that I don't know how it works and that Trump actually had to get whisked away by Secret Service because that's the professionals behind him, listen to what he said.
